intro: Impatiens cothurnoides, commonly known as the white impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Impatiens cothurnoides is also known for its rapid growth and ability to produce numerous blooms throughout the growing season.
